article.title: Digital AFCEA Source Book Now Available
article.author: Maryann Lawlor, SIGNAL Connections
article.abstract: AFCEA members who want to take the AFCEA Source Book with them everywhere can now download it for easy access on their laptop or tablet computers.
article.text: AFCEA members who want to take the AFCEA Source Book with them everywhere can now download it for easy access on their laptop or tablet computers. With the look and feel of a print publication, the digital edition of the Source Book enables users to search for companies, capabilities, people and terms or browse from page to page.Modeled after the digital edition of SIGNAL Magazine, the digital Source Book is being introduced for the first time this year in response to requests from AFCEA members for a portable version of this catalog of fellow members. Users can easily search for potential partners to respond to requests for proposals or find companies that meet the requirements of specific contracts. More information about the digital edition is available online or by contacting Maryann Lawlor at (703) 631-6179.
